channel.title: When everyone is wining about SOPA
channel.description:
While SOPA is the point of discussion, they silently passed ACTA Those [CENSORED] !
http://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2012-01/26/eu-signs-up-to-acta

item.title: When everyone is wining about SOPA
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

Obama signed acta months ago which is questionably unconstitutional. his administration claims its “executive agreement” when the question is is it really? law students are saying that acta isnt under his power to make a sole decision on it and that it has to go through congress first b4 he can sign it. so if you want to join a petition to have him take acta to congress then go find a petition and sign it. there are a couple on the whitehouse.gov you can sign or others on the net. I think Obama said he wouldnt sign sopa or pipa if it made it past congress was he already signed ACTA?

Off Topic: this is my 1000th post.

Read full topic
item.source: When everyone is wining about SOPA

item.title: When everyone is wining about SOPA
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“Brandon Codes, post:17, topic:430683”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=533357.msg3899230#msg3899230 date=1327613239]

Im getting ready to start a WW III… Citizens vs Government. The WHOLE world. Who’s with me?
[/quote]war?
nice you are acting like them now

Whatever you say, war is a necessity. It’s a necessity, because in order to take the governments out and form a new one (Governed by people with EXPERIENCE IN THE REAL WORLD), you would have to SOMEHOW take out their stupid ass thoughts of change. And I really doubt the world could make old people change their mind without killing them. Think about SOPA… ;s fucking old people.[/quote]
Yeah instead of doing the civilised thing (PS I don’t know what diplomacy is) let’s Kill All The Infidels

Read full topic
item.source: When everyone is wining about SOPA

item.title: When everyone is wining about SOPA
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I think its good that people are against violence very strongly here but at the same time I think its pretty annoying how everyone that gets shot down because they want to be violent about it gets insulted.

Anger is a human emotion, violence is more natural than doing rational things. You shouldn’t be insulting him for that, thats like insulting someone for killing an animal for food.

Read full topic
item.source: When everyone is wining about SOPA

item.title: When everyone is wining about SOPA
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“Brandon Codes, post:17, topic:430683”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=533357.msg3899230#msg3899230 date=1327613239]

Im getting ready to start a WW III… Citizens vs Government. The WHOLE world. Who’s with me?
[/quote]war?
nice you are acting like them now

Whatever you say, war is a necessity. It’s a necessity, because in order to take the governments out and form a new one (Governed by people with EXPERIENCE IN THE REAL WORLD), you would have to SOMEHOW take out their stupid ass thoughts of change. And I really doubt the world could make old people change their mind without killing them. Think about SOPA… ;s fucking old people.[/quote]
The government may be ignorant to some of the effects of some of these bills, however killing them won’t solve anything, nor will starting a civil war. The last American civil war cost hundreds of thousands of lives, and there’s no need for that to happen again. The point of the bills are to stop copyright infringement, despite the fact that they need major revising before they even be considered. No one really has experience in “The Real World” because you can never please everyone, they are doing what is best for your well-being and to please the most people they can without loosing support of those they truly rely on.

It’s only those who dislike the acts that rant about it, and in this case it’s everyone who isn’t in a major corporation.

You’re also blowing what your local neighborhood junky can do to highly trained military troops WAY out of proportion.

Read full topic

item.title: When everyone is wining about SOPA
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

It might of been signed, but it still needs to be presented to the European Parliament. The signing is more a statement of intent from the countries as far as I know.

What can you do about Acta? If you don't like the sound of Acta, it's not too late to do something about it. Acta -- like all trade agreements -- still needs to be presented to the European Parliament for a vote.

Read full topic
